positive.review:
Solo dev creates a genre defining game, sells over a million copies, disappears. 

This is the way.
I have been playing this game for 10 years. It still challenges me and the mods all infinite variety. Great game 10/10
Great city building / survival game - Just make sure you also download Colonial Charter mod, which is basically like huge free dlc for it.

Banished is an old game now. With all the mods available its more than one game, its multiple.

Vanilla banished has limited potential and can get repetitive, but with mods and all the community content. Your imagination is basically whats holding you back.

I've spent 3000 hours in Bansihed. 1000 on steam 2000 beforehand. Its a game I often comeback to. Its a game that has gotten many clones, settlement survivor, I'd even say games such as Farthest frontier, Foundation aso. are kind of banished based. 
If you want to play the real thing play banished, and load in some of the great community content. 
Kudos to the developer.

Basically exactly as advertised, it takes a lot more persistence and resource management to build up a satisfying settlement than most other city builders though. Just when you think you're in the clear a new problem sneaks up on you. That push and pull of balancing how much food you have with your tool production and your supply of firewood is tricky but rewarding when you nail it. This is sort of a one-and-done game for me though. I don't think there's nearly enough variety to make starting multiple saves worth it. I played one save for about sixteen hours but really after the first eight it felt like everything was already done, I could keep growing after that but it was just a matter of building more of what I already had and the same problems kept cycling around instead of anything new to catch me off guard.

I don't know if I just got lucky but I hardly ever had any real issues; one disease cropped up but was immediately squashed because I already had a hospital built, only two harvests were infested with pests over the course of about sixty years which is almost none at all, and I never had any insane shortages. That's not to say the game played itself but I feel like a lot of the challenge does just come from experiencing a problem for the first time and not being prepared, so if you are prepared, there's essentially no problem at all. I wish there was bigger goals to strive for but maybe that's beyond the scope of a small colony building indie game from over a decade ago. Some of this game was pretty new for its time and that deserves respect. I liked it, I think you should play it, but probably only once assuming you don't starve your people or freeze them to death in the first few hours.
Great builder game, made even better by allowing mods. One of the GOATs.
As with all games, there is a learning curve. If you enjoy city building games, this is good, It has it's own style, which seems easy to adopt to.

I absolutely love Banished. I have made some massive cities in it and it is very enjoyable. I love that there is no gating: all the buildings are available from the outset and it is up to you to determine what you village can support. It takes some experimenting and getting used to for sure, but it is worth it. I think my least favorite system of the game is the way that population growth works: in Banished if your city isn't growing, it's dying. You can quickly get into death spirals if you aren't careful and aging out a population because you didn't build enough new housing is one of the silliest. You constantly have to have new house, year after year, to avoid your population getting too old to reproduce itself. You can also, eventually, get immigrants who want to join your community... but that isn't the most consistent way to grow. Overall, I love Banished as a very solid game that gives you all the tools you need to grow a city in a way that feels organic.

decided to dig this one out the the old games i got years ago and it was worth it. The game still feels pretty modern and on top of that its actually challenging to play for a city builder. requires you to both look after your people and also your supply chains which is easier said than done.

If you enjoy the big city builders then this one is worth checking out even if it is a bit older now.

It’s an okay city-building game. There isn’t much to do, only a few different buildings and no new technology or buildings to unlock. There’s no real goal except for achievements if you’re into those. Overall I’d give it a 6-7/10.

This game is very fun for how simple it is. And i use simple in the terms of just the overall idea. Manage a city and workers, Build there needs feed them keep them warm. Thats it. But it gets so hard. There is a fun peace to playing this thats worth it even ten years later.
A wonderfully casual game.  Plenty of Mods, and a generally relaxing game to play.
old school and lovely. For me it is challenging as you need to plan your developing of settelments. Rewarding however and very entertaining.

I find this game to be one of the prime examples of a super chill game to pass time.

Mostly pretty simple for a settlement manager. I'm honestly pretty content vanilla, but there are tons of mods to add new elements if you want them.

The game is basically a tug of war of resources, managing population, and racing to establish renewable resources as quickly as possible, meanwhile mining up whatever iron and stone you can get your hands on.

Even just out the box without mods I highly recommend if you like chill settlement managers!

Fun game for what it is. I would highly recomend the death and starving mods out there which fix the broken death and starving bug in game where everyone dies at the same time!! Insane! Otr then one buggy issue fun game! Modable which can expand it greatly!! and you may want to do once you play it for a while to give it more variety. I honestly really wish there was a really good remake of this game expanding it more and higher graphics!! But overall a good game! 3.5 out of 5 for bugs and small variety but still a fun game overall. Also the day adn night cycle is also a nice mod ease's the eye's from time to time and makes it nice and moody lol

Probably the best survival city-builder ever. I keep trying newer ones in hope that they will be as good as this one. Haven't found a proper replacement yet.

The richness of this game together with it simplicty just make it so re-playable. And all the great mods help too.

I've been playing this game since it was released, and it's been a game that I come back to often when I feel like playing a relaxing city builder simulation game (which is one of my favorite genres).  Mods are also super fun in this game!

It's the OG of the modern city builder games we have today. It's got everything in it's more fundamental form. Only gripe i have is at 50 hours in you can feed your peeps and reach the end of the content pretty easy once you have figured out a winning formula, So enjoy your first 25-50 hours then have mods expand your progression and choice.
I love this weird little game. My villagers die by my negligence constantly and yet I keep coming back.

banished is a great game because
it's a easy/hard game and you have
to survive.
Incredible game i discovered through watching asmr in the good old days. Now i use this game whenever i want to set my head to sleep. Cant play otherwise, thus the low amount of hours played :D
I've gotten years and hundreds of hours of enjoyment with this game. Adding mods adds even more fun!

The base game gives you a feel for the game and how to play it, but once you figure out what youre doing and dont keep dying, you get through it quick. Once you do though the mods available make the game last wayy longer!
been playing for over 10 yrs and can say this is a game i can always come back to after a long day. EASY FUN AND MOST OF ALL YOU CAN NORMALLY PUT A DECENT AMOUNT OF HOUR IN ON ONE MAP
I'm a lil dumb so it's real hard and every dies alot, but it's so fun that it's okay.
Old but gold. I can spend hours playing it with no break
Just a genuinely good relaxing time with great economics
Sent 30 kids to work in the mines and then everyone fucking died
Very frustrating but good fun.

10/10 
don't put me in charge of the commune.
Game? What game? This is a way of life. This is what I am now.
calm and pleasant game
great game wish there where updates.
Lovely game. Despite it's age it hold up really well.
Simple game. But challenging.
comfort gaming. I can't keep away from it when I'm stressed.
Love His game 4 stars
best game ever
Relaxing and fun
Winters go boom boom!
I said yes, thats' enough.
Best city builder ever!
GREAT GAME, MAKES YOU USE YOUR NOGGIN
can never have enough farms
It's a nice little game.
Relaxing village building
Enjoyed.
yes
yes
Great! We need Banished 2
balls
BANGER
Simple on Vanilla, Complex modded. Order of business, Food, firewood, tools, clothes, growth. You can place building and then *pause* the build for city planning ;)

Solo dev creates a genre defining game, sells over a million copies, disappears. 

This is the way.
I got this game about 10 years ago. to this day I still boot it up and lose myself in it. If you enjoy town building you will love this game.
Yeah, it's an old game. But the mods are solid, and so are the mechanics. This is the OG of the survival colony sim games.
I have been playing this game for 10 years. It still challenges me and the mods all infinite variety. Great game 10/10

This is my comfort game. I always come back to this game whenever I'm not sure what to play, in a bad mood or if it's a rainy fall day. Or all of the above. I do like to play it with the Mega Mod, as it adds so much more variety and types of villages to build. Expansion is near endless. Love it. :)

If you like to be creative, build and tinker with systems, then this should amuse you.
It is what I would call a 'simple' city (town) builder. If I am not mistaken, it was made by a single person and the game has had great success for a long time. I'd say that's pretty impressive.

The base game is rewarding to play once you get past the brutal learning curve and the active modding community has made great additions to the gameplay. My favorite thing to do once I have everything established is to zoom in and enjoy the character and production animations; they're not super detailed, but after all the work it takes to get there, they're highly rewarding to watch. The music is also the perfect mix of relaxing and invigorating; I can let the game run while I'm doing chores and feel very industrious while doing so.

Banished is an old game now. With all the mods available its more than one game, its multiple.

Vanilla banished has limited potential and can get repetitive, but with mods and all the community content. Your imagination is basically whats holding you back.

I've spent 3000 hours in Bansihed. 1000 on steam 2000 beforehand. Its a game I often comeback to. Its a game that has gotten many clones, settlement survivor, I'd even say games such as Farthest frontier, Foundation aso. are kind of banished based. 
If you want to play the real thing play banished, and load in some of the great community content. 
Kudos to the developer.
This is a rare perfect game for a builder / sim / easy going game.  A must have.  10 out of 10.  I have almost 2000 hours of game play.
Great city building / survival game - Just make sure you also download Colonial Charter mod, which is basically like huge free dlc for it.
The best strat is to get a crap ton of farms early on, and fishing.
I can't believe I had this game in my library!  Tried it when it was new--then forgot about it as I was raiding in WoW.   This is one amazing city-building work of art. Tysm for creating such a game!

Basically exactly as advertised, it takes a lot more persistence and resource management to build up a satisfying settlement than most other city builders though. Just when you think you're in the clear a new problem sneaks up on you. That push and pull of balancing how much food you have with your tool production and your supply of firewood is tricky but rewarding when you nail it. This is sort of a one-and-done game for me though. I don't think there's nearly enough variety to make starting multiple saves worth it. I played one save for about sixteen hours but really after the first eight it felt like everything was already done, I could keep growing after that but it was just a matter of building more of what I already had and the same problems kept cycling around instead of anything new to catch me off guard.

I don't know if I just got lucky but I hardly ever had any real issues; one disease cropped up but was immediately squashed because I already had a hospital built, only two harvests were infested with pests over the course of about sixty years which is almost none at all, and I never had any insane shortages. That's not to say the game played itself but I feel like a lot of the challenge does just come from experiencing a problem for the first time and not being prepared, so if you are prepared, there's essentially no problem at all. I wish there was bigger goals to strive for but maybe that's beyond the scope of a small colony building indie game from over a decade ago. Some of this game was pretty new for its time and that deserves respect. I liked it, I think you should play it, but probably only once assuming you don't starve your people or freeze them to death in the first few hours.

Really fun OG colony game, for being made in 2014 it still holds up as fun in 2025. It's similar to the Anno series except in my opinion has more of a challenge to it which makes it more appealing to me. Once you get the hang of how to play the base game that is.
Great builder game, made even better by allowing mods. One of the GOATs.

It's a very good game with mods added on. It can be boring without them. Not enough features on its own. I enjoy the challenges that come with the came. It's not easy - in a good way. There are many elements to consider, when building your village. The villagers need to be healthy and happy. The town's economy needs to be flush. A strong trade system needs to be managed. With mods, there are lots of buildings and resources to choose from. Without mods, very few buildings and resources to choose from. Overall, I recommend this game. I've spent a ton of time playing it and I still enjoy it.

As a city building game, I think it does very well at balancing the complexity of surviving a harsh environment with little to start and the simplicity of simcity-style builders. You start with a wagon full of goods (or not) and spend your time both maintaining decent population growth and city growth, while also making sure to keep your population happy. A challenging game, but worth it. And when you've gotten the hang of it, there's in-built mod support and a thriving community of modders.

What a great game! 
I was hesistant because it is kind of old but it's so good. When you want some more than the vanilla game there's a mod in the workshop expanding the game to glorious proportions. 
GET IT, you won't regret it

Fun game loop. Manage a village or manage a town. The expansion rate and things to do can get pretty wild when you have hundreds or thousands of citizens. Workshop full of content to make it more entertaining if you run out of things to do too

This is the distilled essence of settlement builders. It is THE source, the holy grail. And it actually runs at 60fps even with large colonies.
However, since it is simply just so pure of an experience - it's easy. I got to 300 pop just by reading the in-game manual and preparing for the surprisingly small amount of issues that can happen. After getting to that population it got a bit boring, there's not much variety in what you can do after getting a stable population of that size.

8/10 I'd say
Never ending possibilities and mods make the game a forever fave.
As with all games, there is a learning curve. If you enjoy city building games, this is good, It has it's own style, which seems easy to adopt to.

I absolutely love Banished. I have made some massive cities in it and it is very enjoyable. I love that there is no gating: all the buildings are available from the outset and it is up to you to determine what you village can support. It takes some experimenting and getting used to for sure, but it is worth it. I think my least favorite system of the game is the way that population growth works: in Banished if your city isn't growing, it's dying. You can quickly get into death spirals if you aren't careful and aging out a population because you didn't build enough new housing is one of the silliest. You constantly have to have new house, year after year, to avoid your population getting too old to reproduce itself. You can also, eventually, get immigrants who want to join your community... but that isn't the most consistent way to grow. Overall, I love Banished as a very solid game that gives you all the tools you need to grow a city in a way that feels organic.

If you enjoy the big city builders then this one is worth checking out even if it is a bit older now.

It’s an okay city-building game. There isn’t much to do, only a few different buildings and no new technology or buildings to unlock. There’s no real goal except for achievements if you’re into those. Overall I’d give it a 6-7/10.

Probably the best survival city-builder ever. I keep trying newer ones in hope that they will be as good as this one. Haven't found a proper replacement yet.

The richness of this game together with it simplicty just make it so re-playable. And all the great mods help too.
fun little sim, been experimenting with my villagers it's all fun till a natural disaster hits xD

Banished is a fun, albeit simple, village sim that lets you build and maintain a medieval village.  While the base game doesn't have a lot in the way of structures to build and things to manage, various mods make the game have a lot of replace value.  MegaMod in the workshop is notable for those looking to change their gaming experience with Banished.  

Banished is simple.  If you are just looking to waste some time, build a little village with very little turmoil, and watch your population grow while managing food, basic resources, and trade, then Banished might be for you.  For an in-depth city management / great strategy game, this won't be for you.
A good city/ village builder. It's a good sit back and build. Make sure you have enough food production.

Just realised this came out in 2014 - certainly doesn't feel like it. Comfort game that I keep coming back to occasionally play.

I wouldn't buy it for 20 euros, but I would definitely recommend it if it were on discount.

Banished is a fantastic, pure city-builder with a unique charm. There's no combat, just the brutal and beautiful struggle against nature. Managing your citizens from a handful of pioneers to a thriving, self-sufficient town is incredibly rewarding. The core gameplay loop is simple to learn but difficult to master, leading to many "just one more year" sessions. Highly recommended for fans of peaceful, thoughtful strategy games.
If you're looking for a rts medieval city building sim to play in leisure time without much hassle this is the game.
Epic super fun watch out for them bad things lol

Love the game tons

Really recommend this game if you like city building and devolpment
This is a great rural town simulator. I really enjoy it. It has no military aspect to it, just a great sandbox. It is not, however, easy.
Love the game, my issue the game always wants to be on the right screen. Also little his the Farms cant just go over them.

I love Banished. I've been playing it for years and it never gets old. I still find it challenging and yet relaxing.
Highly recommend.
It's always satisfying to play on hard difficulty, survive long enough on fish, venison, and random gathered roots to build a trading post and get all the seeds and animals for farming.
You have the opportunity to build a flourishing city that will inevitably die from a tornado and disease. Top-tier game :)
Difficult city builder. Adds a sense of challenge not present in other games like it. Not a casual builder.
Nice, calm game. Not stressful or addicting, quite pleasant.

negative.review: I like the graphics and flow of the game just wish there was a way to enlarge the font/text on the game. I play it on a 65" TV, so I have plenty of viewable area yet there's no way to make the font size any larger than what it originally was. Ironically if I were on my original monitor I could read it alright... but then I would also be within feet of the monitor versus 6-9 feet back from the TV

This game was meh. The music was okay. No action/combat situations, all I remember is my colonists dying in the bitter cold, you want to know what else was bitter? My wallet. So I immediately Banished this product from my Steam Library because I could not handle this product (just like my villagers and the cold).
looked super fun, ended up being pretty disappointed.
Bugs and it is no longer maintained by the dev or community

very limited amount of buildings and jobs - played everything tooooo much already after 9 hours.

only thing you can do is built multiple trading harbors and hope that the ships will bring new seeds and animals. otherwise you will be bored.
boring

You have to like really slow games to play it. For me the game is just borring. The point with the game is to find a balance. Growth takes time. I even tried it with mods to see if that made things less borring, but no it's not (I only tried it with a few minor mods). Most of the time I just let the game run on high speed and did other things. If you are looking for a city builder or a game similar to CivCity Rome then this is not the game for you. To me it don't look like this is a game for the average city builder gamer.

so this game is very odd, not well thought through, with and awful UI. 

i have now managed to perfect game it after wayy too many hours of playing and my own desires. 
to keep in short: 
- the game is not intuitive
- the amount of food produced varies on the factors of: people, tools, education, weather, happiness, travel time. 
- some food buildings produce small amounts all year around, others produce big in one go. 
- resources in game to support house building are hard to get, so its a slow start.
- to get anywhere in a reasonable gaming session the timer needs to be set to 10. 
- some buildings will be a lot of resources spent, but not actually do much until late game (church, well, marketplace,)
- there are different options for clothing to prevent dying from weather, but its not obvious.
- variety of food is needed to keep people happy, but this isnt obvious.
- the map generated is random, but can have a lot of odd deadspace meaning certain maps are almost unplayable. 
- game is less resource management and more people management.
- storage in barns is different depending on what is being stored.
- trading system relies on random traders turning up by boat, some are great others are just awful and pointless.

Overall, not a game i would recommend. a lot of trial and error.

I like the graphics and flow of the game just wish there was a way to enlarge the font/text on the game. I play it on a 65" TV, so I have plenty of viewable area yet there's no way to make the font size any larger than what it originally was. Ironically if I were on my original monitor I could read it alright... but then I would also be within feet of the monitor versus 6-9 feet back from the TV
There are better of the same kind of games that are more user friendly, have more content, receive more updates and cost less. It's an OK game but not for the price.

To me it don't look like this is a game for the average city builder gamer.

so this game is very odd, not well thought through, with and awful UI. 

i have now managed to perfect game it after wayy too many hours of playing and my own desires. 
to keep in short: 
- the game is not intuitive
- the amount of food produced varies on the factors of: people, tools, education, weather, happiness, travel time. 
- some food buildings produce small amounts all year around, others produce big in one go. 
- resources in game to support house building are hard to get, so its a slow start.
- to get anywhere in a reasonable gaming session the timer needs to be set to 10. 
- some buildings will be a lot of resources spent, but not actually do much until late game (church, well, marketplace,)
- there are different options for clothing to prevent dying from weather, but its not obvious.
- variety of food is needed to keep people happy, but this isnt obvious.
- the map generated is random, but can have a lot of odd deadspace meaning certain maps are almost unplayable. 
- game is less resource management and more people management.
- storage in barns is different depending on what is being stored.
- trading system relies on random traders turning up by boat, some are great others are just awful and pointless.

Overall, not a game i would recommend. a lot of trial and error.

I like the graphics and flow of the game just wish there was a way to enlarge the font/text on the game. I play it on a 65" TV, so I have plenty of viewable area yet there's no way to make the font size any larger than what it originally was. Ironically if I were on my original monitor I could read it alright... but then I would also be within feet of the monitor versus 6-9 feet back from the TV
There are better of the same kind of games that are more user friendly, have more content, receive more updates and cost less. It's an OK game but not for the price.

This game was meh. The music was okay. No action/combat situations, all I remember is my colonists dying in the bitter cold, you want to know what else was bitter? My wallet. So I immediately Banished this product from my Steam Library because I could not handle this product (just like my villagers and the cold).
looked super fun, ended up being pretty disappointed.
Bugs and it is no longer maintained by the dev or community

very limited amount of buildings and jobs - played everything tooooo much already after 9 hours.

only thing you can do is built multiple trading harbors and hope that the ships will bring new seeds and animals. otherwise you will be bored.
poor resource managment. crashes all the time during game play. not worth it
Very simple gameplay, have to do the same things in order every game.
boring

You have to like really slow games to play it. For me the game is just borring. The point with the game is to find a balance. Growth takes time. I even tried it with mods to see if that made things less borring, but no it's not (I only tried it with a few minor mods). Most of the time I just let the game run on high speed and did other things. If you are looking for a city builder or a game similar to CivCity Rome then this is not the game for you. To me it don't look like this is a game for the average city builder gamer.
